item.title: One liners x7
item.author: htonydeng+blog@gmail.com (Tony Deng)
item.description:
They’re as silly as they are short.

It isn’t easy to be original and even harder to be actually funny. I’ll get straight to it:

  1. I substituted the thyme with time.
  2. I rarely find myself in front of The Rock and A Hard Rock Cafe, but when I do it’s when I’m writing a post about oneliners.
  3. A baby shower at a divorce hearing is no fun for both parties.
  4. A casino goer was punched while at the blackjack table. This was the third run and pun incident this week.
  5. Donald Trump’s humble side.
  6. I always make an effort not to mention Japan while I shop for German Kitchenware.
  7. Manners are as old as the trees, always start your request with “Wood you please”.

In the writing of this post, I realized the value of delivery to a joke. If you didn’t laugh while reading it, try telling it to a friend (and share the blog). Hopefully they don’t get injured laughing out loud.

On Friday, I’ll talk about why I think VR is the future but AR is the present. Next Monday will a bring a review of a few movies I recently watched.

If nothing up above gave you a laugh, hopefully this will:

item.title: How I missed the moon ... and the schedule
item.author: htonydeng+blog@gmail.com (Tony Deng)
item.description:
It’s less than a week since I’ve set up the blog and I already missed the first deadline.

To be honest…

This does segue into a fun topic to explore, the idea of expectations. A generally good way to live life is to under-promise and over-deliver. Assuming a bit of common sense about not bottoming out on expectations, you will always surprise yourself and other people (Great success!). I have generally done the opposite, setting unrealistic expectations and ending with an average to above-average performance.

This blog is currently fairly average by my performance standards: Use Hugo, write, push to github on time.

I apologize for not getting this post out on time. I hope Monday’s post will arrive on time but I’m moving into residence that day so anything goes :)

A lesser known side effect of not meeting expectations

… is that one gets a lot of practice with completing “post-mortems”. I’ll share the one I wrote up in response to being late for the first serious blog post:

Why it happened

  • I’m lazy
  • Computers are hard
  • Nuka World just released for Fallout 4

How I can remedy the situation

  • Post as soon as possible
  • Apologize profusely
  • Add extra markdown flair to distract from late-ness (Say hello to pictures and a table of contents!)

How I’ll prevent it from happening again

  • Write a quick outline of the next post immediately after writing current post
  • Make a habit of practicing periodic concentration to ward off procrastination
  • Edit the blog timestamp Post something on time and edit later if time permits

To conclude

Enough one-liners to last you a week are (probably) coming out on Monday - I’ve already written up the outline. That’s all folks!

item.title: Hello world!
item.author: htonydeng+blog@gmail.com (Tony Deng)
item.description:
“A legendary blog begins with a single post” - 21st Century Confucius

Welcome to the blog. I promise it won’t always be this cheesy. I’m Tony, currently finishing my first co-op term and moving into 2A Mechatronics Engineering at the University of Waterloo.

I’m starting a blog so I can write a bit more outside of Facebook messages and class notes. I would also like to share some knowledge about topics that don’t get brought up in normal conversation.

I don’t plan on adding a comment section to my posts but if you have any feedback feel free to send me an email at htonydeng+blog@gmail.com.

The current plan is two write two blog posts a week. One serious post and one that isn’t. The tentative schedule is a funny post on Monday and a serious post on Friday. I’m currently trying to work on my humor so I’m going to be posting a compilation of 7 fun one-liner jokes that I think of during the week. More fun things to come!

Until then, see you all this Friday!
